Reviews.Title: “Nice Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DalpalOttawa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a basic one from the perspective of its general location and decor. The staff was very helpful in providing us information to use the tram to get into the city center and how to return to the hotel. They do not have a great command of English but the desire to communicate existed. Took care to ensure we knew to pay attention for pick pockets on the tram (no incidents for us). We had room 207 and did not find it to be too noisy even though it was close to a busy intersection with many ambulances passing by due to close proximity of a hospital. Walking to right from the hotel will take you down to a street with many shops. First appearance of the neighbourhood had me questioning the decision to stay at the hotel but it was perfectly acceptable and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but an Italian Basil Fawlty on reception!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we planned, as a foursome, to sightsee in Rome. The hotel had no parking so a bit difficult but we managed. It looks nothing from the outside, set back off the street. But once inside it is very clean and nice, and when we were shown to our rooms we were very pleasantly surprised. The room is quite large, very clean, nice bedding and towels, changed daily. However, several things left a lot to be desired. I had read several reviews previous to booking in, about how nice the Austrian lady owner is, and the staff etc. Unfortunately the nice Austrian lady owner was nowhere to be seen, and we just had a surly unhelpful elderly man, who wouldn't even lift his head in the morning to say hello. He was not at all helpful, and didn't put himself out at all....even to the point of NOT OPENING THE BAR. The little bar was there alright, but in darkness. Not once in the 5 days we were there did he open it. The breakfast was very meagre, rolls, jam and sweet croissant. Served by a very nice polite ?Thai lady, who couldn't do enough for us. We could have done with a mini-bar in the room due to not being able to have a drink in the hotel. So apart from the lack of mini-bar, Basil Fawlty on reception, and no bar to have a drink in, the stay was quite good. Not sure I would stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Tidy”
Reviews.Author: MinicoopMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in august .. We were pleastanly surprised .. We had room 307 which was situated at the front of the building had our own small balcony... Room was big enough very clean, air con, shutters which kept the room dark and made it easy to sleep in ... Although it was not in the heart of Rome, the tram stop was a two minute walk at end of street ...we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Second time there, perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie_Montreal
Reviews.Content: I visit Rome, Italy every two years. Hotel Monteverde is a very clean and basic hotel, reasonable rates, friendly service, wifi, tv, and close to the tram, just cross the street, and you're there. The tram takes you to the center of Rome (a very short ride), where you can easily walk to the Colisseum and Piazza Venezia, or take the buses to the these places as well as to the Vatican. Very easy to get around in Rome with buses and trams. Hotels in the center of Rome charge much more, so it's worth it to stay at Hotel Monteverde. Very safe and clean area. Hotel has no pool, and no parking. Parking is on the street - just like the romans do. Breakfast is very basic - rolls with butter and jam, packaged croissants, and coffee and excellent cappucino.. Rome is an amazing city, with lots to do and discover. Will stay there again - staff is very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: birdieboys
Reviews.Content: We were sent here upon the recommedation of a local. The hotel is small, quiet, clean and in a true Roman area. The breakfast is nothing special , just rolls and coffee, but that is often typical of European hotels.The rooms are moderately sized with large bathrooms.Although not located within walking distance of the city center, there is a tram stop at the corner, making the city easily accessible. I would stay here again and highly recommend it for value, comfort and most of all cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Out-of-the-way, but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: GadgetmanNH
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great staff and good value. The owners are from Austria, and really have created a nice, clean and safe hotel. The tram stop is just at the top of the hill. The tram runs about every 10 minutes and takes you right into the center of Rome (a 7 day pass is about 11 euro, if I remember correctly and available at most news stands). There is also an internet and phone shop just outside the entrance to the hotel. Calls back to the states are really inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home !”
Reviews.Author: moltobuono
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth time in this lovely hotel. Also our teenagers loved it. Very clean, very friendly, extremely helpful staff, delicious breakfast, reasonable price, good location-the tram takes you to the centre very conveniently in about 10-15 minutes. Will defenitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giada551
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel. A friend, who lives in the area had recommended it to us. It's very clean and comfortable, and we loved the breakfast they provide. The owners are very nice people and helpful with your sightseeing trips. It is a little far from the center of town, but once you have the metro or the bus route down pat, it's not bad. There are a couple of nice restaurants right next door if you do not want to venture into town. We higly recommend it and will go back there again at our next visit.
